conclusion: Analyzing conditions for total internal reflection in bent optical fiber
Optical fiber with circular cross-section bent into semicircle, refractive index N, outside is vacuum, light enters at A and exits at B
Need to find minimum radius r for total internal reflection
Critical angle for total internal reflection is when angle of incidence exceeds critical angle θc
Critical angle θc is given by sinθc = 1/N
Light travels in straight lines inside fiber, smallest incident angle at outermost part of bend
Critical case when light ray hits outer boundary at critical angle θc
Triangle formed with hypotenuse from center to point C, distance r + D/2, adjacent side r
Need incident angle θ to be ≥ critical angle θc, so cosθ ≤ cosθc
Solving for r gives r ≥ (√(N²-1) * D/2) / (N - √(N²-1))
